required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preventing Excessive Gestational Weight Gain in Obese Women
clinical_study.official_title: Preventing Excessive Gestational Weight Gain in Obese Women

lead_sponsor.agency: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo

clinical_study.source: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to study the effects of a multicomponent lifestyle intervention that includes partial meal replacements as a means to prevent excessive gestational weight gain in obese women. The primary hypothesis is that the intervention will reduce the rate of gestational weight gain compared with standard care.

primary_outcome.measure: Weight Gain Per Week of Observation
primary_outcome.description: Rate of gestational weight gain will be computed as difference between weights measured at study entry and gestational week 35; this difference will be divided by the number of weeks of observation during pregnancy (i.e., weeks between study entry and final pregnancy assessment). If gestational week 35 is unavailable, most proximal clinic visit weight will be used.

secondary_outcome.description: Offspring weight for age z scores from birth (1 week), to 6 months, and 12 months of age.
Changes in offspring intake of breast milk (#feeds per day) and/or formula (#feeds per day).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Women Exceeding IOM Guidelines as a Proportion of Total Number of Women in Each Group.
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported pre-pregnancy weight will be subtracted from weight measured at last clinic visit prior to delivery. Women will be categorized as exceeding 2009 IOM guidelines if the difference is > 11.5 kg gain for women with prepregnancy overweight or >9 kg for women with prepregnancy obesity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Women at or Below Prepregnancy Weight as a Proportion of the Total Number of Participants in Each Group
secondary_outcome.description: Weight measured at 48-56 weeks postpartum and subtracted from self-reported prepregnancy weight and then categorized as at or below vs. above self-reported prepregnancy weight.

intervention.description: The intervention is a multicomponent program designed to prevent excessive gestational weight gain in obese women through modifications of diet, exercise, and behavioral strategies during pregnancy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Over 18 years old
- < 16 weeks gestation
- BMI >= 25
- Willing to consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant with Twins
- Untreated medical or psychological problem
- Inability to be physically active

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo

group.title: Standard Care
group.description: Participants in the enhanced-usual care group received all aspects of usual care offered by their prenatal care providers, including physicians, nurses, nutritionists, or counselors from the Women, Infants, and Children's Special Supplemental Nutrition Program (WIC)

group.title: Lifestyle Intervention
group.description: Lifestyle intervention: The intervention is a multicomponent program designed to prevent excessive gestational weight gain in obese women through modifications of diet, exercise, and behavioral strategies during pregnancy.

baseline.population: Participants who withdrew (N = 7) are not included in baseline analysis population table or in any results.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
